greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of unlabeled connectedness systems covering n vertices without singletons.
comment: We define a connectedness system (investigated by Vim van Dam in 2002) to be a set of finite nonempty sets (edges) that is closed under taking the union of any two overlapping edges.
example: Non-isomorphic representatives of the a(3) = 4 connectedness systems:
xref: The case with singletons is A326871.
First differences of A072444 (the non-covering case).
Euler transform of A072445 (the connected case).
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Aug 02 2019
